subject: RE: [junit] OT: OO Newcomer
msgSnippet: ... Personally I find one of the best ways of weaning people from procedural to OO was to get them using UML (specifically class diagrams). This helps them
messageBody:
>
> I would like to ask the people on this list for
> recommendations of the best
> literature to bring an OO newbie up to speed.
>

Personally I find one of the best ways of weaning people from procedural to
OO was to get them using UML (specifically class diagrams). This helps them
visualize their OO structure and allowed them access to literature such as
GoF much more easily.

joe

Joe Heath
Logica
"It takes 43 muscles to frown, and it takes 17 muscles to smile, but it
doesn't take any at all to sit there with a dumb look on your face"
